word_mean: 测量天体高度的仪器。由一刻有度数的圆盘及一根瞄准管构成。
观测恒星在不同方位相继通过一个固定天顶距的时刻来同时测定时间和纬度的仪器。
用于观测、记录一组恒星通过同一等高圈之时刻、纬度的仪器。

sentence.Network_en: Mariners were also able to fix their latitude by using an instrument called astrolabe.
sentence.Network_cn: 海员们还可使用星盘这种仪器确定纬度。

sentence.Network_en: Mariners were also able to fix their latitude , by using an instrument called an astrolabe.
sentence.Network_cn: 海员们还可使用星盘这种仪器确定纬度.

sentence.Network_en: Other early instruments included the sextant and the astrolabe.
sentence.Network_cn: 另外的早期仪器还有六分仪和星盘.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 星盘（astrolabe）是一个标有刻度的圆盘，用于测量太阳或某个恒星的垂直倾角。 这种星盘是专门为航海制造的，能够适应大海和风 …
另外，托勒玫亦对数学，尤其在三角学上作出贡献，并把他的理论运用到「等高仪」(astrolabe) 及「日晷」(sundial) 的制作上。托勒玫同时又对光学及地理学进行研究，提出「经」、「纬」度概.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : from Old French astrelabe, from medieval Latin astrolabium, from Greek astrolabon, neuter of astrolabos 'star-taking'

auth_sentence.content: But, in the absence of any overwhelming evidence one way or the other, until the nineteen-fifties the astrolabe theory held sway.

auth_sentence.content: The archeologists, led by J. N. Svoronos, of the National Museum, thought that the artifact must have been a kind of astrolabe.
